Description: Body sherd of Chian, possibly Wild Goat Style, pottery chalice with part of cul; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black with band in faded added white at bottom of sherd; exterior: glazed above single line; reserved below.
Curator's comments: The cul is more pronounced on the earlier styles of Chian pottery than on the later styles. The lack of interior decoration suggests that the sherd is early.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0067) (phase 2)
